name: Ethereum
description: A decentralized, open-source blockchain platform with smart contract functionality. Ether (ETH) is the native cryptocurrency.
blocks: Ethereum is a decentralized, open-source blockchain system that features smart contract functionality. It was proposed in 2013 by programmer **Vitalik Buterin** and development began in 2014, with the network going live on **July 30, 2015**.
Ether (ETH) is the native cryptocurrency of the platform. It is the second-largest cryptocurrency by market capitalization, after Bitcoin.

- **Consensus:** Proof of Stake (since The Merge, Sept 2022)
- **Block time:** ~12 seconds
- **Smart contract languages:** Solidity, Vyper
- **EVM:** Ethereum Virtual Machine — the runtime for smart contracts
- **Major upgrades:** Frontier, Homestead, Metropolis, The Merge, Shanghai

name: Geo
description: A decentralized knowledge graph protocol enabling collaborative, permissionless knowledge curation on the internet.
blocks: Geo is a decentralized protocol for structuring and sharing knowledge on the internet. It combines a **knowledge graph** data model with **blockchain-based** governance to enable open, permissionless knowledge curation.
The protocol allows anyone to create, edit, and organize information as interconnected entities — each with typed properties, relations, and rich content blocks.
